alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Madison; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 05 at 4:26AM EST until January 05 at 10:45AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Broad River near Broad River above Carlton affecting Madison, Elbert and Oglethorpe Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Broad River near Broad River above Carlton. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Minor flooding will expand further into the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 72 bridge. A sand dredge operation on the left bank near the gage will become flooded. A large portion of Roy Wood Road will be flooded with several feet of water and the Broad River Outpost for Canoes and Kayaks location will be under water. Flooding of the yard behind an assisted living home off of Roy Wood Road will continue to expand. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 AM EST Thursday was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 4.6 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 15 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
